src:
Ini yang Bikin Zenfone 6 Telat Masuk Indonesia
07 Nov 2019, 21:40 by Anggoro Suryo Jati - detikInet


Foto: Adi Fida Rahman/detikINET

Jakarta - Butuh waktu lama bagi Asus untuk merilis Zenfone 6 ke Indonesia, setelah diluncurkan secara global pada akhir Mei lalu. Apa penyebabnya?Tertundanya kehadiran Zenfone 6 terbilang unik, karena sebenarnya unit ponsel yang akan dipasarkan di Indonesia sudah tersedia di Batam, tempat pabrik perakitan ponsel tersebut. Namun ponsel yang sudah siap dipasarkan itu belum bisa dikirim ke Jakarta.Hal ini menurut Muhammad Firman, Head of Public Relation & e-Marketing Asus Indonesia, disebabkan adanya perizinan yang belum selesai. Perizinan yang dimaksud Firman ini bukanlah izin TKDN dan SDPPI."TKDN sebenarnya sudah jadi sejak lama, namun masih ada dokumen perizinan yang belum selesai. Jadi unit ponselnya sudah ada di Batam tapi belum bisa dikirim ke Jakarta," ujar Firman kepada detikINET di Jakarta, Kamis (11/7/2019).Terhambatnya perizinan ini, menurut Firman, terjadi karena adanya rotasi di jajaran manajemen Asus. Termasuk orang yang bertanggung jawab untuk mengurus perizinan ke pihak pemerintahan.Bahkan, karena unit ponsel di Batam sempat menumpuk, Asus sempat mengekspor unit Zenfone 6-nya ini ke negara lain, ke sejumlah negara di Eropa dan juga Jepang."Dari pada stoknya numpuk di gudang, ada demand dari negara lain yang butuh Zenfone 6, ya sudah kami kirim ke Eropa dan Jepang," ungkap Firman ketika ditemui usai peluncuran Asus ExpertBook di Jakarta (29/8).Namun, sebelum dijual di sana Zenfone 6 sempat diuji dulu quality controlnya di Eropa dan Jepang. Hasilnya ternyata memenuhi standar untuk beredar di kedua pasar tersebut. "Berarti kan kualitas produk yang dibuat pabrik kami di Batam itu sudah bisa memenuhi standar untuk dijual di sana," ujarnya.Karenanya ke depan Asus akan kembali mengekspor ponsel made in Indonesia ke sejumlah pasar di luar negeri. Hanya saja tidak disebutkan ponsel apa yang akan dikirim."Ke depannya ada beberapa tipe yang dipasok dari pabrik kami di Batam," pungkas Firman. Simak Video "Zenfone 6 'Made in Indonesia' Mendarat hingga ke Eropa, Apa Kata Asus?"[Gambas:Video 20detik](asj/fyk)
text:
This is what makes Zenfone 6 late entering Indonesia
Nov 7 2019, 21:40 by Anggoro Suryo Jati - detikInet


Photo: Adi Fida Rahman / detikINET

Jakarta - It took a long time for Asus to release Zenfone 6 to Indonesia, after it was launched globally at the end of May. What is the cause? The delay in the presence of the Zenfone 6 is quite unique, because actually the mobile units that will be marketed in Indonesia are already available in Batam, where the mobile assembly plant is located. However, mobile phones that are ready to be marketed cannot be sent to Jakarta. This is according to Muhammad Firman, Asus Indonesia's Head of Public Relations & e-Marketing, due to unfinished licensing. The licensing referred to by Word is not a TKDN and SDPPI permit. "TKDN has actually been made a long time ago, but there are still licensing documents that have not yet been completed. So the cellphone unit is already in Batam but cannot be sent to Jakarta," Firman told detikINET in Jakarta, Thursday (11/7/2019). The delay in licensing, according to the Word, occurred because of a rotation in the Asus management ranks. Including the person responsible for taking care of licensing to the government. In fact, because the cellphone units in Batam had piled up, Asus had exported its Zenfone 6 to other countries, to a number of countries in Europe and Japan. " warehouse, there are demands from other countries that need Zenfone 6, so we've sent it to Europe and Japan, "said Firman when met after the launch of Asus ExpertBook in Jakarta (29/8). However, before being sold there Zenfone 6 was tested for quality first control in Europe and Japan. The result turned out to meet the standards for circulation in both markets. "That means the quality of the products made by our factory in Batam can meet the standards for sale there," he said. Because in the future Asus will re-export mobile phones made in Indonesia to a number of overseas markets. It's just not mentioned what cellphones will be sent. "In the future there are several types supplied from our factory in Batam," concluded Firman. Check out the video "Zenfone 6 'Made in Indonesia' Landing as far as Europe, What does Asus say?" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (asj / fyk)
